DIV1.HEAD: QƲERIES in Order to the Description of BRITANNIA.

LIST.ITEM: 2 The several Hundreds, Parishes, Villages and Hamlets.
4 Cities, Towns Corporate, Market-Towns and Fair-Towns
6 Castles, Churches, Chappels, Monasteries, Hospitals, Schools, Colleges.
8 Chaces, Forrests, Woods, Groves, Parks, Warrens, Com∣mons, Heaths.
10 Places where Battles have been, Lodges in Forrests, &c.
11 Works and Mines of Salt, Lead, Tin, Iron, Coal, Lime, Alabaster, Marble, Free-stone, Grindstone, Mill-stone, Silver, Gold, Copper.
12 Waters, Springs and Baths, Cold or Hot, Medicinal, Bi∣tuminous Petrifying, &c.
14 What Part of the Countrey is Arrable, Pasture, Meadow.
15 Roman Ways and Stations, Coyns and Monuments, &c.
18 Peculiar Customs or Manners of the Countrey.
19 Places of Birth, Education or Habitation of Eminent Persons, in all Ages.

P.HI: Of these, or any of them, Information is desir'd in Writing, either upon certain Know∣ledge, or other good Authority, directing each Remark to the Number relating to it, and annexing thereto the County and Hundred wherein the Remark falls.

ADD.NOTE: My name to be putt to those Counties which I describe
